main event: Officers observed a bright unidentified object in Georgetown, Massachusetts on February 6, 1957.
interesting points: The first officer described the object as a bright light that made a clockwise circuit before moving straight out of sight., The second officer confirmed seeing the same object., Ground personnel noted an extremely bright object that remained stationary for a period before disappearing., No visible exhaust trail or sound was detected during the observation., The object was viewed through 7 x 50 binoculars.
witness description: first officer, second officer, ground personnel
